intro: ^You open the door to the precinct, feeling the rusty hinges struggle to keep the door from scratching the floor. To say that this place is abandoned wouldn't be right, as the dustless desks give the space some form of life. However, the absence of...well people would argue otherwise.
^A hand is placed on your shoulder.

scared: ^"Hey! Woah! Sorry, didn't mean to scare you!"
wasntScared: ^"I think the whole town heard you."
^They laugh to themselves, their cheeks with a slight hint of red.
^"I- well- I'm sorry, who are you?!"
introductions: ^"Oh! Sorry! I'm Misra! It's nice to meet you!"
silence: ^You shake their hand and watch their smile slightly curl in silence.
niceToMeet: ^You grab their hand, and they give a vigorous shake you can feel up to your shoulder.
nameCorrection: ^"Right! Right! Detective Lupe! Say, do you mind if I call you just...Lupe? I mean you don't have to call me sheriff Misra so let's just drop the formalities?"
precinct: ^They gesture at a desk with chairs adjacent to each other.
^You sit down on one side, and watch them fling themselves into the other chair.
^Some of the wheels lift off the ground as they flail to re-gain their balance, eventually grabbing onto the desk and pulling themselves to stability.
laugh: ^You let out a light puff of air from your nose and uninentionally make eye contact.
dontLaugh: ^You can already hear her nagging voice telling you "You should stop calling people morons, Lupe."
^"You need to give people chances, Lupe."
^"I can't bail you out of HR again, Lupe."
^This is going to be a challenge.
^You unintentionally make eye contact with Misra.
questions: ^"A tree fell on the way here."
coffee: ^"Yeah, there's a coffee pot over there."
^You get up from your desk and walk over to the coffee pot. It's lukewarm, and you could've sworn there was a fly in there. Maybe your mind is just playing tricks on you.
RejectCoffee: ^It's probably best you don't drink this. You have a case to solve, and the last thing you need is a fly in your stomach.
^Heading back from the desk, Misra makes eye contact with you.
selfishCoffee: ^You pour yourself a black cup of coffee, hoping that the possible fly didn't get in there.
^Sitting back down at your desk, you watch Misra get up and walk over to the coffee table.
^They begin pouring enough creamer and sugar to the point where the liquid is practically white. There's hardly a difference between that concoction and a sugary cup of milk.
^They sit across from you once again.
MisraCoffee: ^You pour two black cups of coffee.
^Create a concoction of sugar and creamer
BlackCoffeeMisra: ^You grab the two cups, head back to the desk, and put the black cup in front of Misra.
^You watch Misra get up and walk over to the coffee table.
^They begin pouring enough creamer and sugar to the point where the coffee is practically white. There's hardly a difference between that concoction and a sugary cup of milk.
^They sit across from you once again.
MisraCoffeeWrong: ^You take an educated guess that Misra may not like their coffee black. They would appreciate you adding some sweeteners.
^After making some adjustments, you head back to the desk, and put the cup in front of Misra.
^You watch Misra get up and walk over to the coffee table.
^They begin pouring enough creamer and sugar to the point where the coffee is practically white. There's hardly a difference between that concoction and a sugary cup of milk.
^They sit across from you once again.
MisraCoffeeRight: ^You take an educated guess that Misra may not like their coffee black. They would appreciate you adding some sweeteners.
^A gut feeling begins to arise, and you follow your intuition.
^You grab the two cups, head back to the desk, and put the cup in front of Misra.
^"No! No! It's...just how I like it. Thank you."
fallen_tree: ^"Not too far from here, maybe 2 minutes out."

^"aw shit that sucks. i'll call the tree people here and get that cleared asap so you can get going. but just so you know that could take days, this down isn't exactly the most busy if you can tell." They gestured around the police station with open arms.
^"Good to know! I'll file a report."
^"How long would it take to clear?
clear: ^"Oh! Good question! Well, I'm not sure."
^"We don't have many working hands here, so it may be a bit before that road gets cleared."

c-1: ^ Misra nods their head in silence, their lips curling into an awkward smile.

police_report: ^"Right! The case! Almost forgot about that, ha ha!"
^They take out a thin file and place it in front of you.

b: ^ and taking a sip of your coffee

police_report: ^, you begin to read through the 3 pages there.
^[NAME] Winery, a rickety local winery that recently closed, is currently slated for demolition.
^And a black and white picture of the winery stained with age.
^"Not much to conclude right now, this is quite bare-bones information."
^"But I'll let my supervisor know what's going on to keep on record."

c-0: ^ like a pretty simple job. Shouldn't take me more than a day to figure this out."

b: ^ grab your phone and begin to

phone_call: ^"Hello this is Sheryl Thelton. I currently can't come to the phone right now, but please leave a message after the beep. If this is Lupe, just call again like you usually do. I'll pick up eventually. Thank you."
voicemail: ^"Thelton, Lupe here. No cracks on the case yet but seems like may be a simple case. Should be back in Dafenport by tomorrow morning. I'll keep you updated."
^"Well I'm going to need to see this place myself. Can't really figure out much from this file alone."
^They spring out of their desk, jokingly gesturing towards the door.
JokeBack: ^That slight joke may have drained your social battery for the week.
door: ^You walk through the door, not saying a word to Misra.
^"Alright! Misra and Lupe on the case! Watch out Kettle Rock, we gon'na figure you OUT!"
